newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria had $9.655 bln foreign debt end-1996. [CORRECTED 17:50 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria had $9.655 bln foreign debt end-1996. [CORRECTED 17:50 GMT]

text.p: (Corrects figures in headline and first paragraph to "billion" from "million")
Bulgaria's gross foreign debt was reduced last year to $9.655 billion from $10.229 billion in 1995, figures published by the Bulgarian National Bank showed.
"Bulgaria has covered $1.048 billion of principal and interest dues in 1996, up from $943.4 million in 1995," said the BNB.
The gross debt was reduced by $574 million last year and new loans worth $314.8 million were borrowed, said the BNB.
Long-term debt was reduced by in 1996 by some $560 million to $8.281 billion or 85.8 percent of gross foreign debt (GFD) from $8.841 billion or 86.4 percent of GFD in 1995.
Commercial debt restructured in Bulgarian government Brady bonds was reduced last year to $4.984 billion or 56 percent of total debt from $5.005 billion in 1995.
Dues to multilateral lenders have risen to $1.714 billion last year or 17.8 percent of total debt from $1.657 billion in 1995.
Debt to the Paris Club of government creditors stands at $1.034 billion or 10.7 percent of total debt.
Bulgaria's grave economic crisis led to shrinking GDP which resulted in rising debt to gross domestic product ratio in 1996 to 99.1 percent from 78.7 percent in 1995.
